article.title: How do I change the download location?
article.description:
By default, torrents are downloaded to the music or video library in the app. However, if you give the app permission, you can change the download location to any folder on your phone. To do this, tap on the hamburger menu icon, then tap on Settings, tap on the "change" option next to Default Download Folder, choose the folder of your preference then finally tap on OK. When you download new torrents, they will download to this new default location.

If you wish to change the download location for a single torrent already downloading, go to the torrent list view, then tap on the torrent to view its files, tap on the three dots menu (Kebab menu), this will reveal the overflow menu. From there, tap Move File. The directory will open and you will be able to choose any destination from there.

From there, tap Move File. The directory will open and you will be able to choose any destination from there.

articleList.title: How do I search for and add a torrent?
articleList.description: Start with a search. Tap on the magnifying glass in the upper-right corner of the screen in portrait (vertical) mode, and then enter a search term. Your browser will open. Start searching for what you’d like to download. Remember that you are looking for a torrent file (file ends in .torrent) or magnet link. Tap on the .torrent file or magnet link, and our app will open and prompt you to select the files you wish to download within the torrent. Choose a download location, then tap ‘Add.’

Tap on the .torrent file or magnet link, and our app will open and prompt you to select the files you wish to download within the torrent. Choose a download location, then tap ‘Add.’

articleList.title: How do I choose which files I want to download within a torrent?
articleList.description:
You can choose the files a few different ways.  To choose the files before you add a torrent, when you tap on a torrent link or magnet link in your web browser and choose to download it with our app, a popup will prompt you to select your files from within the torrent & choose a location before downloading.  Tap Files To Download, then uncheck the files you don’t want to download.  Then tap OK, then tap Add.  

Alternatively, you can choose the files after the torrent has already started downloading.  To do this, tap on the torrent, this will send you to the Files page.  Next, tap on the three dots menu next to the file you wish to exclude and tap on Exclude.

articleList.title: How do I pause downloading? How do I pause seeding?
articleList.description:
To pause downloading all torrents, go to the torrent list view, tap on the menu button (three dots) in upper-right corner of the screen in portrait (vertical) mode, then tap Pause All. Note that some Samsung devices will have the menu button in the lower right corner of the phone, not on the actual screen. To pause downloading one or more torrents, tap on the toggle next to the torrents you would like to pause.
Tip: once you’ve selected one torrent, you can select all of the rest by tapping on the button that appears on the upper-right corner.  It looks like a box with multiple dots around it.

To pause seeding on all torrents, tap on the menu button (three dots) in upper corner of the screen in portrait (vertical) mode from the torrent list view.  Tap Pause All’.  Note that some Samsung devices will have the menu button in the lower right corner of the phone, not on the actual screen.  To pause seeding on one or more torrents.  Tap on the toggle next to the torrents you would like to pause. 

Tip: once you’ve selected one torrent, you can select all of the rest by tapping on the button that appears on the upper-right corner.  It looks like a box with with multiple dots around it.

articleList.title: How do I play torrent files?
articleList.description:
You can play a torrent while it is still downloading. To do this, go to the torrent list view, then tap on the torrent you wish to play.  This will land you on the Files page for your torrent.  Tap on the icon of the file you wish to play or open.

You may be prompted to choose a player to open the file.  Note that in order to play media files, you will need to find and install a media player in the Play Store that is compatible with the file you downloaded.  Many phones come with media players installed, so you may not need to download one.

Tip: If you are having trouble, search for the extension of the file you are trying to play, then search the Play Store to find the top-rated app that supports your file.

You may be prompted to choose a player to open the file.  Note that in order to play media files, you will need to find and install a media player in the Play Store that is compatible with the file you downloaded.  Many phones come with media players installed, so you may not need to download one.  Tip: If you are having trouble, search for the extension of the file you are trying to play, then search the Play Store to find the top-rated app that supports your file.

articleList.title: Where are my downloaded files?
articleList.description: Tap on the corresponding torrent from the torrent list view, tap on the file you would like to locate. Tap on the three dots icon at the right hand top corner of the app, then tap on move torrent. You will then be able to see the torrent location and move it to a destination of your preference.

Tap on the three dots icon at the right hand top corner of the app, then tap on move torrent. You will then be able to see the torrent location and move it to a destination of your preference.

articleList.title: How do I remove the advertising?
articleList.description: Upgrading to BitTorrent Pro ($2.99) removes ads your mobile torrent client. To subscribe to BitTorrent Pro, please visit BitTorrent Pro
articleList.description_text: Upgrading to BitTorrent Pro ($2.99) removes ads your mobile torrent client. To subscribe to BitTorrent Pro, please visit BitTorrent Pro

articleList.title: Why is my download speed extremely slow?
articleList.description:
A number of things can be causing this issue.  Let's eliminate these one-by one:

 

1. NO SEEDERS: The most common issue is the torrent does not have enough people sharing the file or "seeders". You can check to see if there are enough seeders for the file by checking the file using this website - https://checker.openwebtorrent.com/

 

2. WIFI ONLY MODE: Your app is in ‘wifi-only mode’ and you are not on a wifi network.  To check this, tap on the hamburger menu button (three lines) in upper corner of the screen in portrait (vertical) mode, then tap on ‘Settings’. Uncheck the box for Wifi Networks Only, this will turn it off.

 

3. POOR CONNECTION: Your network connection is poor (common).  To check this, try streaming content on your browser or an app (e.g YouTube).  If you can stream content without too much buffering, then you probably have a strong connection.  Alternatively, check your wifi speed with the free Speed Test app from Google Play. Here's a popular one - https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=org.zwanoo.android.speedtest

 

4. BLOCKED WIFI: Your wifi network connection is blocked by the ISP.  This means your network is blocking torrent files, or is blocking your outgoing port.  To check this, try downloading a Featured Content torrent on another network.  If you can download a torrent on another network (particularly a fast wifi network), then it’s likely that your wifi network is causing the issue.  To fix this, tap on Menu, then Settings, then Incoming TCP Port in our app.  Look at the TCP Port number, and increment it up by one.  For example, if your port number is 6881, make it 6882.  If this doesn’t work, your wifi network may be throttling BitTorrent traffic, in which case we can't help with a workaround.  

 

5. PHONE ISSUE: The app isn't working well with your device.  To check this, delete any unfinished torrents, then close the app.  Next, delete BitTorrent app data by going to your phone’s Settings, then Apps, Manage apps, then BitTorrent, then Storage, then Clear Data.  Next, reboot your phone, then uninstall and reinstall the app, then reboot your phone again.  Then try downloading a test torrent here - https://webtorrent.io/free-torrents

 

6. NOT SHARING FILES: You are not seeding, and the swarm is ignoring you.  If you are not seeding, you may be anonymously identified by the swarm as a leecher.  Leeching means you download, but you don’t share.  Some users reporting slowdowns after using the app for a long time are having this issue due to not seeding.  To check this, go to your phone’s Menu, then Settings, then Upload limit, then change this to a reasonably number (not zero).  Try seeding a little, and see if your torrents start speeding up.  But please don’t do this with your data plan.  Use wifi-only mode, which is also under Settings.

articleList.title: Why am I consuming much more data than the file’s download size?
articleList.description:
You are receiving files from other peers that are not required.  Sometimes incoming data does not match what you requested, so the files are discarded.  This is also known as wasted data, and it is common.

If you would like to reduce your data consumption, you can pause seeding on one or more torrents.  Tap on the toggles next to the torrents you would like to pause.  To pause all torrents, tap on the menu button (three dots) in upper corner of the screen in portrait (vertical) mode.  Tap ’Pause All’.  Note that some Samsung devices will have the menu button in the lower right corner of the phone, not on the actual screen. 

When you’re back on wifi, you can resume seeding on all torrents by tapping on the menu button (three dots) in upper corner of the screen in portrait (vertical) mode.  Tap ‘Resume All.’  Or, you can resume one or more torrents by tapping on the toggles next to the torrents you would like to resume. Note that some Samsung devices will have the pause button (||) in the lower right corner of the phone, not on the actual screen.
articleList.description_text: You are receiving files from other peers that are not required.  Sometimes incoming data does not match what you requested, so the files are discarded.  This is also known as wasted data, and it is common.  If you would like to reduce your data consumption, you can pause seeding on one or more torrents.  Tap on the toggles next to the torrents you would like to pause.  To pause all torrents, tap on the menu button (three dots) in upper corner of the screen in portrait (vertical) mode.  Tap ’Pause All’.  Note that some Samsung devices will have the menu button in the lower right corner of the phone, not on the actual screen.   When you’re back on wifi, you can resume seeding on all torrents by tapping on the menu button (three dots) in upper corner of the screen in portrait (vertical) mode.  Tap ‘Resume All.’  Or, you can resume one or more torrents by tapping on the toggles next to the torrents you would like to resume. Note that some Samsung devices will have the pause button (||) in the lower right corner of the phone, not on the actual screen.

articleList.title: What is seeding?
articleList.description: Thank you for the question.  Seeding means sharing a file(s) with other peers.  After a torrent job finishes downloading, if you leave the torrent job seeding, it uploads the file(s) to other peers so they can enjoy them too.  Although the length of time that you should leave the file seeding is not defined, it is recommended that you share until the amount of data you upload reaches at least the same as the amount of data that you have download, also known as reaching a 1.0 ratio. It’s difficult to know exactly when you hit this ratio but generally people who leave the swarm before even getting close to that ratio are labeled as leechers.  Because leechers have a detrimental effect on swarms, some peers or even private trackers may block connections to you.

articleList.title: Is the app available in other languages?
articleList.description: Currently the app is available in English, Portuguese, Spanish, Italian and Russian.  If your phone OS is defaulted to one of these languages, the app will auto localize.
articleList.description_text: Currently the app is available in English, Portuguese, Spanish, Italian and Russian.  If your phone OS is defaulted to one of these languages, the app will auto localize.

articleList.title: I bought BitTorrent Pro from within the app. But when I see the app in Google Play, it looks like I still need to buy it. Do I have to buy it twice?
articleList.description:
You certainly don’t need to purchase the app twice.  First, make sure you have wifi connectivity. Next, make sure you are logged into the same Google Play account that you purchased the app from. Next, close your app and reopen it.  BitTorrent should turn into Pro automatically (it pings Google Play to verify that you have bought the upgrade). You will know it is Pro because the app's name will now be listed as BitTorrent Pro under the menu icon in the upper left corner of the app.

If you bought Pro as a standalone app (not from within the app as an upgrade), you can re-download Pro directly from Google Play.  Make sure you are logged into the same Google Play account that you purchased the app from, and µTorrent should turn into Pro automatically.

If none of these suggestions help, or if you accidentally purchased Pro twice, please contact us and we will help you sort it out.

If none of these suggestions help, or if you accidentally purchased Pro twice, please contact us and we will help you sort it out.

articleList.title: Why can’t I open a magnet link anymore? The app hangs on gathering info.
articleList.description:
First, please make sure the app is set up as your default torrent downloader.

Be very patient with these.  The app takes relatively longer to fetch the torrent info from Magnet links. The torrent will start downloading, but it can take quite a bit longer.
articleList.description_text: First, please make sure the app is set up as your default torrent downloader.  Be very patient with these.  The app takes relatively longer to fetch the torrent info from Magnet links. The torrent will start downloading, but it can take quite a bit longer.

articleList.title: Why can I not play the file?
articleList.description: It sounds like you are trying to play a file type that is not supported by the media player on your device. Please make sure you have a media player installed on your phone (you can download a free media player on Google Play).  Tip: search for the extension of the file you are trying to play, and find the top-rated app that supports your file.
articleList.description_text: It sounds like you are trying to play a file type that is not supported by the media player on your device. Please make sure you have a media player installed on your phone (you can download a free media player on Google Play).  Tip: search for the extension of the file you are trying to play, and find the top-rated app that supports your file.

articleList.title: I cannot download to my SD card. What am I doing wrong?
articleList.description:
Make sure the app has access (permissions) to your external storage.

From within the app, open the corresponding torrent, tap on the file you would like to move. Tap on the three dots icon at the right hand top corner of the app, then tap on move torrent. You will then be able to see the torrent location and move it to a destination of your preference.

If this does not work, one workaround is to download the torrent to your phone, then use a free file manager app on the Google Play Store to move the file around.

Tap on the three dots icon at the right hand top corner of the app, then tap on move torrent. You will then be able to see the torrent location and move it to a destination of your preference.  If this does not work, one workaround is to download the torrent to your phone, then use a free file manager app on the Google Play Store to move the file around.

articleList.title: Why does my download make progress but then stop or hang?
articleList.description:
A number of things can be causing this issue.  Let's eliminate these one-by one:

1. The most common issue is that the health of your torrent is poor.  To check this, try using this site: https://checker.openwebtorrent.com/. The key difference between a torrents with poor health and a good torrent is the number of seeds (these are usually heavily seeded), therefore they are being shared a lot.  

2. Your app is in ‘wifi-only mode’ and you are not on a wifi network.  To check this, tap on the menu icon (hamburger icon) in left corner of the header, then tap on ‘Settings’.  Uncheck the box for Use Wi-Fi networks only’.

3. Your network connection is poor.  Check your wifi speed with a free Speed Test app from Google Play.

The key difference between a torrents with poor health and a good torrent is the number of seeds (these are usually heavily seeded), therefore they are being shared a lot.    2. Your app is in ‘wifi-only mode’ and you are not on a wifi network.  To check this, tap on the menu icon (hamburger icon) in left corner of the header, then tap on ‘Settings’.  Uncheck the box for Use Wi-Fi networks only’.  3. Your network connection is poor.  Check your wifi speed with a free Speed Test app from Google Play.

articleList.title: After downloading a file, I cannot find it in my download location. Why?
articleList.description: First, make sure you have the proper storage permissions set up on your phone.  Next, open your phone’s settings and then tap Apps. Find our app and tap on it, then tap on Permissions. This allows you to store files in your default download folder. Next, tap on a torrent in your torrent list view, tap on the three dots icon at the right hand top corner of the app then tap on move torrent. You will then be able to see the torrent location.

Find our app and tap on it, then tap on Permissions. This allows you to store files in your default download folder. Next, tap on a torrent in your torrent list view, tap on the three dots icon at the right hand top corner of the app then tap on move torrent. You will then be able to see the torrent location.

articleList.title: I downloaded a video file. Why is there no audio?
articleList.description: There are a few reasons why this can happen. Either it's a bad torrent, or more likely your media player doesn't have the correct codec to decipher the audio stream, therefore the audio will not play. There are several good media players (e.g. VLC media player is a free and open source cross-platform multimedia player) that can play most video and audio formats.
articleList.description_text: There are a few reasons why this can happen. Either it's a bad torrent, or more likely your media player doesn't have the correct codec to decipher the audio stream, therefore the audio will not play. There are several good media players (e.g. VLC media player is a free and open source cross-platform multimedia player) that can play most video and audio formats.

articleList.title: Is there a way to limit my battery usage when using your app?
articleList.description: In the Pro version, there is a feature in the app settings called Battery Saver which automatically pauses seeding as well as your current torrent downloads when the battery is low.  Outside of Pro, power savings can be managed manually by limiting your seeding and downloading to when you have adequate battery life.
articleList.description_text: In the Pro version, there is a feature in the app settings called Battery Saver which automatically pauses seeding as well as your current torrent downloads when the battery is low.  Outside of Pro, power savings can be managed manually by limiting your seeding and downloading to when you have adequate battery life.

articleList.title: How do I see the full name of the file being downloaded?
articleList.description:
Tap on a torrent in your torrent list view.  The full name of the torrent is displayed at the top of your screen.

Tip: try tilting your phone to landscape mode to view the full name of a file.
articleList.description_text: Tap on a torrent in your torrent list view.  The full name of the torrent is displayed at the top of your screen.  Tip: try tilting your phone to landscape mode to view the full name of a file.

articleList.title: My mobile device doesn’t have enough storage to download the file. What do I do?
articleList.description: You’ll need to move files off your phone or delete files in your storage to make room.
articleList.description_text: You’ll need to move files off your phone or delete files in your storage to make room.

articleList.title: Why is my app crashing?
articleList.description:
Please clear data from the BitTorrent app by going to (within Android) Settings, then Apps, then BitTorrent, then Storage, then Clear Data and reboot. Then try downloading a torrent with many seeds. If the app is still crashing, try uninstalling and reinstalling. Then, repeat the step above by trying to download a torrent with many seeds.

Feel free to contact us if the issue persists.
articleList.description_text: Please clear data from the BitTorrent app by going to (within Android) Settings, then Apps, then BitTorrent, then Storage, then Clear Data and reboot. Then try downloading a torrent with many seeds. If the app is still crashing, try uninstalling and reinstalling. Then, repeat the step above by trying to download a torrent with many seeds.  Feel free to contact us if the issue persists.

articleList.title: Why am I losing Internet connectivity?
articleList.description:
There are a few reasons this might happen.  Firstly, if you are losing your connection when your phone sleeps, it’s likely that your battery and or data usage/savings features are enabled on your phone.  If you wish to keep our app running in the background, try going to your phone’s settings and look under both the battery and data settings to allow our app to run in the background. 

Another scenario is that you have set up your downloads to run over wifi only, and you exited the wifi’s coverage.  To change the setting to download over wifi and on your data plan, go to Settings, then Wifi Networks only, then uncheck the box to deactivate this option.

Finally, it’s possible that your Internet service provider is throttling or even blocking the traffic.  This can happen during peak hours or when you have exceeded your data limits.

Finally, it’s possible that your Internet service provider is throttling or even blocking the traffic.  This can happen during peak hours or when you have exceeded your data limits.

articleList.title: Why does the app stop running/downloading when my screen goes off?
articleList.description: It seems like you have battery and or data usage/savings features enabled on your phone.  If you wish to keep our app running in the background, try going to your phone’s settings and look under both the battery and data settings to allow our app to run in the background. There are helpful guides that you can find online to help you manage these settings for your specific phone model and OS.

There are helpful guides that you can find online to help you manage these settings for your specific phone model and OS.

articleList.title: How do I reduce my data consumption?
articleList.description:
The best way to reduce your data consumption is to pause seeding on one or more torrents. Tap on the toggle next to the torrent you would like to pause.  To pause all torrents, tap on the menu button (three dots) in upper corner of the screen in portrait (vertical) mode.  Tap ’Pause All.’. Note that some Samsung devices will have the menu button in the lower right corner of the phone, not on the actual screen. 

When you’re back on wifi, you can resume seeding on all torrents by tapping on the menu button (three dots) in upper corner of the screen in portrait (vertical) mode.  Tap ‘Resume All.’ Or, you can resume one or more torrents by tapping on the toggles again. Note that some Samsung devices will have the pause button (||) in the lower right corner of the phone, not on the actual screen.
articleList.description_text: The best way to reduce your data consumption is to pause seeding on one or more torrents. Tap on the toggle next to the torrent you would like to pause.  To pause all torrents, tap on the menu button (three dots) in upper corner of the screen in portrait (vertical) mode.  Tap ’Pause All.’. Note that some Samsung devices will have the menu button in the lower right corner of the phone, not on the actual screen.   When you’re back on wifi, you can resume seeding on all torrents by tapping on the menu button (three dots) in upper corner of the screen in portrait (vertical) mode.  Tap ‘Resume All.’ Or, you can resume one or more torrents by tapping on the toggles again. Note that some Samsung devices will have the pause button (||) in the lower right corner of the phone, not on the actual screen.

articleList.title: I upgraded to Pro, then I uninstalled. How do I get Pro back on my phone?
articleList.description:
If you bought the app directly from the Google Play store, simply reinstall it from the Play store. First, make sure you are logged in to the same Google account that you bought the app with. Next, on your Android phone or tablet, open the Google Play store app, then tap Menu, then tap My apps & games, then tap Library. Tap the µTorrent app, then tap Install or Enable.

If you bought the upgrade through an in-app purchase, make sure you are logged in to the same Google account that you bought the app with. Next, go download the free version from the Play store.  Once you open the app, it will upgrade itself to Pro automatically.
articleList.description_text: If you bought the app directly from the Google Play store, simply reinstall it from the Play store. First, make sure you are logged in to the same Google account that you bought the app with. Next, on your Android phone or tablet, open the Google Play store app, then tap Menu, then tap My apps & games, then tap Library. Tap the µTorrent app, then tap Install or Enable.  If you bought the upgrade through an in-app purchase, make sure you are logged in to the same Google account that you bought the app with. Next, go download the free version from the Play store.  Once you open the app, it will upgrade itself to Pro automatically.

articleList.title: I can't activate my Pro subscription on another device. Why not?
articleList.description:
It is possible to activate your Pro subscription across multiple devices.  However, there are some steps to follow in order to do this properly.  Please note that there are two ways you could have initially purchased Pro:

1. You downloaded the free version from the Google Play store and then upgraded to Pro through the app.

2. You downloaded the Pro version from the Google Play store. 

In order to install Pro on another device, such as a new phone, you must follow the exact same process as when you initially purchased Pro.  For example, if you purchased Pro by downloading the free version from the Google Play store and then upgraded once inside the app, please do the same on your new device and it will upgrade automatically.  Also remember to login using the same account that you initially purchased Pro.

articleList.title: I’m subscribed to BitTorrent Pro on my phone. Will the subscription activate BitTorrent Pro on my Windows computer?
articleList.description: At this time, a different subscription is required for BitTorrent Pro for Windows and BitTorrent Pro for mobile.  If you would like to activate a Pro subscription for your Windows computer, you can purchase this subscription from https://www.bittorrent.com/products/win/bittorrent-classic-free/

articleList.title: I’m trying to find the best torrent. Can I see the number of peers and torrent health?
articleList.description: Yes. Tap on the torrent, then tap on the Details tab, which is right next to the Pause and the three dots menu.
articleList.description_text: Yes. Tap on the torrent, then tap on the Details tab, which is right next to the Pause and the three dots menu.

articleList.title: My download is stuck at 0%. How do I restart the download?
articleList.description:
Press on the torrent file that is at 0% to select it, then tap the Pause button.  Press on the torrent again to select it, then tap the Resume button.  If this does not work, click on More Actions and select Resume All option.  

In addition, if you have an antivirus installed, this might be blocking the app's access to the internet. We recommend adding an exception or temporarily disabling it. You may also want to try turning off any VPN and Proxy connections you have in place.
articleList.description_text: Press on the torrent file that is at 0% to select it, then tap the Pause button.  Press on the torrent again to select it, then tap the Resume button.  If this does not work, click on More Actions and select Resume All option.    In addition, if you have an antivirus installed, this might be blocking the app's access to the internet. We recommend adding an exception or temporarily disabling it. You may also want to try turning off any VPN and Proxy connections you have in place.

articleList.title: Why can’t I download using wifi?
articleList.description:
A number of things can be causing this issue.  Let's eliminate these one-by one:

1. Your network connection is poor (common) or you are not actually connected to wifi.  To check this, try streaming content on your browser or an app (e.g YouTube).  If you can stream content without too much buffering, then you probably have a strong connection. Alternatively, check your wifi speed with the free Speed Test app from Google Play.

2. Your wifi network connection is blocked by the ISP.  This means your network is blocking torrent files, or is blocking your outgoing port.  To check this, try downloading a Featured Content torrent on another network.  If you can download a torrent on another network (particularly a fast wifi network), then it’s likely that your wifi network is causing the issue.  To fix this, tap on Menu, then Settings, then Incoming TCP Port in our app.  Look at the TCP Port number, and increment it up by one.  For example, if your port number is 6881, make it 6882. If this doesn’t work, your wifi network may be throttling BitTorrent traffic, in which case we can't help with a workaround.
articleList.description_text: A number of things can be causing this issue.  Let's eliminate these one-by one:  1. Your network connection is poor (common) or you are not actually connected to wifi.  To check this, try streaming content on your browser or an app (e.g YouTube).  If you can stream content without too much buffering, then you probably have a strong connection. Alternatively, check your wifi speed with the free Speed Test app from Google Play.  2. Your wifi network connection is blocked by the ISP.  This means your network is blocking torrent files, or is blocking your outgoing port.  To check this, try downloading a Featured Content torrent on another network.  If you can download a torrent on another network (particularly a fast wifi network), then it’s likely that your wifi network is causing the issue.  To fix this, tap on Menu, then Settings, then Incoming TCP Port in our app.  Look at the TCP Port number, and increment it up by one.  For example, if your port number is 6881, make it 6882. If this doesn’t work, your wifi network may be throttling BitTorrent traffic, in which case we can't help with a workaround.

articleList.title: How do i remove (not pause) a torrent when it's finished seeding?
articleList.description: Go to your torrent list, then long press on the torrent.  A trash can will display.  Tap on the trash can, which will ask if you also want to delete the files.  Select your option and then tap Delete.
articleList.description_text: Go to your torrent list, then long press on the torrent.  A trash can will display.  Tap on the trash can, which will ask if you also want to delete the files.  Select your option and then tap Delete.

articleList.title: When I open the app, why does it start downloading a torrent that already completed?
articleList.description:
This can occur if you deleted or moved the file(s) from your default download location and did not delete the torrent(s) from the app.  Each time the app launches, it will check to see if the file(s) are completely assembled. If they are incomplete or missing from the default download location, which will be the case if you moved or deleted the files, the app will begin to download the file(s) again.

In order to delete a torrent from your torrent list (once you have downloaded your file(s), go to your torrent list, then long press on the torrent.  A trash can will display. Tap on the trash can, which will ask if you also want to delete the files. Select your option and then tap Delete.
articleList.description_text: This can occur if you deleted or moved the file(s) from your default download location and did not delete the torrent(s) from the app.  Each time the app launches, it will check to see if the file(s) are completely assembled. If they are incomplete or missing from the default download location, which will be the case if you moved or deleted the files, the app will begin to download the file(s) again.  In order to delete a torrent from your torrent list (once you have downloaded your file(s), go to your torrent list, then long press on the torrent.  A trash can will display. Tap on the trash can, which will ask if you also want to delete the files. Select your option and then tap Delete.

articleList.title: Why is the app consuming more data than is contained in the file I’m downloading?
articleList.description:
There are a few reasons why this might be happening:

You are receiving files from other peers that are not required. Sometimes incoming data does not match what you requested, so the files are discarded. This is also known as wasted data, and it is common.

Seeding can also lead to more data consumption than is contained in the file you downloaded. If you would like to reduce your data consumption, you can pause seeding on one or more torrents. Tap on the toggle next to the torrents you would like to pause. To pause all torrents, tap on the menu button (three dots) in upper corner of the screen in portrait (vertical) mode. Tap ’Pause All.’. Note that some Samsung devices will have the menu button in the lower right corner of the phone, not on the actual screen.

Tap on the toggle next to the torrents you would like to pause. To pause all torrents, tap on the menu button (three dots) in upper corner of the screen in portrait (vertical) mode. Tap ’Pause All.’. Note that some Samsung devices will have the menu button in the lower right corner of the phone, not on the actual screen.

articleList.title: Why is the app consuming my data even though I’m not downloading?
articleList.description: Seeding can consume data when you are not downloading.  If you would like to reduce your data consumption, you can pause seeding on one or more torrents.  Tap on the toggle next to the torrents you would like to pause. To pause all torrents, tap on the menu button (three dots) in upper corner of the screen in portrait (vertical) mode.  Tap ’Pause All.’.  Note that some Samsung devices will have the menu button in the lower right corner of the phone, not on the actual screen.

articleList.title: Why does the file show as 100% downloaded, but pieces are missing when I go to play it?
articleList.description: This is likely down to a poor quality torrent and not the app.  Please try to find another, higher quality torrent.
articleList.description_text: This is likely down to a poor quality torrent and not the app.  Please try to find another, higher quality torrent.

articleList.title: I have downloaded files but they are not in my default download location. What am I doing wrong?
articleList.description: First, make sure your device has the correct storage setting when using the app. To do this, open the main app Settings, then tap Apps, Manage Apps. Next, tap on our app and then tap on App Permissions, then tap on Files and Media. To turn the setting on, check the option "Allow access to media". Next, press on a torrent, then tap on the three dots icon at the right hand top corner of the app then tap on move torrent. You will then be able to see the torrent location and move it to a destination of your preference.
articleList.description_text: First, make sure your device has the correct storage setting when using the app. To do this, open the main app Settings, then tap Apps, Manage Apps. Next, tap on our app and then tap on App Permissions, then tap on Files and Media. To turn the setting on, check the option "Allow access to media". Next, press on a torrent, then tap on the three dots icon at the right hand top corner of the app then tap on move torrent. You will then be able to see the torrent location and move it to a destination of your preference.
